intro: Epilobium × barnadesianum, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers in clusters, which are typically arranged in elongated inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
